body_html:
I totally back this up.

There are some irritating situations caused by the attempts to control the verbosity of TF. For example, if we set the min log level to warning or error, tf.Print stops working. I just happen to want a tf.Print in my program without cluttering all my logs with the mostly useless information TF outputs.

There should be a "silent mode" with two levels that displays errors and warnings, while still allowing the users to print/debug whatever they want. On one occasion, I spent more than 30 minutes asking myself why my code was crashing without printing my debugs, and changing it in many ways, until I remembered log levels.

body:
I totally back this up.

There are some irritating situations caused by the attempts to control the verbosity of TF. For example, _if we set the min log level to warning or error, tf.Print stops working_. I just happen to want a tf.Print in my program without cluttering all my logs with the mostly useless information TF outputs.

There should be a "silent mode" with two levels that displays errors and warnings, while still allowing the users to print/debug whatever they want. On one occasion, I spent more than 30 minutes asking myself why my code was crashing without printing my debugs, and changing it in many ways, until I remembered log levels.
